title: How to Connect Airpods to Dell Laptop

steps.title: Open the Action Center.
steps.content: Open the Action Center. You can do this by clicking the Action Center button in your taskbar (it looks like a chat bubble icon) or you can press Win + A .

steps.title: Right-click the Bluetooth tile and click Go to Settings.
steps.content: Right-click the Bluetooth tile and click Go to Settings . You'll find it with the Bluetooth icon, and selecting Go to Settings will open Settings in a new window. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the toggle next to "Bluetooth" to turn it on (if it's off).
steps.content: Click the toggle next to "Bluetooth" to turn it on (if it's off). If this switch is already on (to the right and colored in), you can skip this step. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You should see something like "Now discoverable as (Laptop Name)" under "Bluetooth" when this feature is activated.

steps.title: Click Add Bluetooth or other device and select Bluetooth.
steps.content: Click Add Bluetooth or other device and select Bluetooth . You'll see this first option at the top of the window next to + . When prompted to select a device that you're pairing, click to choose Bluetooth and all the Bluetooth devices within range will appear here. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Put your AirPods into Pairing Mode.
steps.content: Put your AirPods into Pairing Mode. You can do this by opening the AirPods case, then pressing and holding the button on the back of it. [4] X Research source When the LED flashes white, release the button. This light is either on the front or inside your case.

steps.title: Click your AirPods.
steps.content: Click your AirPods. You should see this device under your list of discovered devices. Pairing between your AirPods and Dell will begin as soon as you select them from the list.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . After your AirPods and laptop pair, you can click Done to close this window. If they aren't automatically switched to the active sound output, click the speaker icon in your taskbar, then select your AirPods from the list. [5] X Research source You will not have access to Siri on a Dell laptop.

steps.title: Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on your laptop.
steps.content: Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on your laptop. You won't see your AirPods in the "Available Devices" list if you have Bluetooth disabled. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If Bluetooth is already on, try turning it off and back on again while your AirPods case is closed.

steps.title: Check if your Bluetooth driver is out of date.
steps.content: Check if your Bluetooth driver is out of date. If it's out of date, you might have issues connecting to your AirPods including an unreliable connection that randomly disconnects. Update your Bluetooth driver , and try again. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Try to connect to other Bluetooth headphones.
steps.content: Try to connect to other Bluetooth headphones. Doing this will text if the Bluetooth on your laptop is the issue or if the problem lies elsewhere. If different headphones connect reliably, the AirPods are most likely the problem. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Make sure your AirPods are in Pairing Mode.
steps.content: Make sure your AirPods are in Pairing Mode. Put them in Pairing Mode by pressing and holding the only button on the AirPods case with the lid open. Release the button when you see the LED flash white (the light is either on the front or inside your case). [9] X Research source

steps.title: Ensure that your AirPods have a charge.
steps.content: Ensure that your AirPods have a charge. Once you place the case on a charging mat or use a charger, the LED should indicate the charge level of your AirPods (an amber light means they are charging and a green light indicates that they have a full charge). [10] X Research source
